metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9444 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - negligible
metadata.Description:
In the Android kernel in sync debug fs driver there is a kernel pointerleak due to the usage of printf with %p. This could lead to localinformation disclosure with system execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1006-azure - 5.4.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-gcp - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-oracle - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1007-oem - 5.6.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1007-raspi - 5.4.0-1007.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-9.12').
linux-kvm package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1004.4').
linux-aws package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1005.5').

linux-oem-5.6 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.0-1007.7').

linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
